business.headline: Piyush Goyal slams Indian startups, urges to shift focus from food delivery appsUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal criticised India's startup ecosystem, saying it's too focused on food delivery, betting, and fantasy sports apps. In contrast, he praised Chinese startups for prioritising advanced tech like EVs, batteries, semiconductors, and AI, urging Indian innovators to shift toward deeper, tech-driven innovation.

Sensex down 800 points: 3 reasons behind today's stock market bloodbathStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down over 817.77 points to 75,477.59 around 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 22,943.30 to trade below 23,000. Today's slump on Dalal Street was on expected lines as analysts said Trump's tariffs have created a lot of uncertainty and could trigger a recession.

What has he done? Startup leaders criticise Piyush Goyal's 'dukaandari' jibeStartup ecosystem leaders' response came after Piyush Goyal took a firm stance and said that while Indian startups were busy building food delivery platforms and fantasy gaming apps, those in countries like China were working on EVs, semiconductors, batteries, and AI.

Sensex tanks over 700 points as Wall Street bloodbath sinks Indian IT stocksStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 698.89 points to 75,596.47 at around 10:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 269.50 points lower at 22,980.60.

Trump's tariff jitters hit US stocks: Will Sensex, Nifty feel the heat today?The extensive tariff announcements by the US government have raised concerns about a global recession, leading to sharp losses in stock markets worldwide.

Stocks to watch on April 4: Shares in news; HDFC Bank, Zomato, DMartStocks in news today: In Friday's session, shares of Zomato, Nestle India, HDFC Bank, DMart, Mazagon Dock, Bajaj Finance, and others will be in focus due to key corporate developments and financial updates.

Dukaandari hi karni hai? Piyush Goyal slams startups stuck on food deliveryCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal asked Indian startups to shift their focus from food delivery apps to high-tech sectors like semiconductors and AI.

Trump tariff blitz wrecks Wall Street, markets suffer biggest fall since CovidTrump's sweeping tariffs sent shockwaves through financial markets, with Wall Street suffering its worst decline since 2020. Analysts warn of economic slowdowns, surging inflation, and a potential recession.

US tech, retail stocks lead rout after Trump's tariff blowTrump's broad tariffs send US markets into a tailspin, with tech, retail, and banking stocks plunging. Apple, Walmart, and Nike face rising costs, while energy prices drop amid economic concerns.

Wall Street opens sharply lower amid trade war fears after Trump tariffsWall Street's major indexes fell sharply after President Trump's new tariffs raised trade war fears. The Dow dropped 2.66%, the S&P 500 declined 3.32%, and the Nasdaq plunged 4.50%, reflecting market uncertainty.

Wall Street bleeds as Trump's tariffs stoke recession fears: 3 things to knowThe Dow Jones Industrial Index fell sharply by over 1,100 points, while the Nasdaq was down over 800 points moments after the US markets opened for trading.

PPF nomination updation now free, says Nirmala SitharamanIt is important to add a nominee to the PPFaccount so that the money is transferred in a smooth manner in the event of the death of the PPF account holder.

entertainment.headline: Sikandar box office day 5: Salman Khan's film inches close to Rs 100 crore markSalman Khan's action drama Sikandar continues to struggle at the domestic box office. The film, directed by AR Murugadoss, earned Rs 90 crore in just five days.
How Manoj Kumar earned the title 'Bharat Kumar'Veteran actor Manoj Kumar has died. He was 87. Kumar had earned the moniker 'Bharat Kumar' for his work in Hindi cinema.

When Manoj Kumar called Akshay Kumar his true successorVeteran actor Manoj Kumar has died at 87. The late artiste once called Bollywood star Akshay Kumar his 'true successor' when it came to portraying a country-loving person on screen.
Akshay Kumar, Khushbu Sundar and celebs mourn Manoj Kumar's deathAkshay Kumar, Khusbhu Sundar, among other celebrities, condoled the death of Manoj Kumar. The veteran actor died at 87.

My baby she ran away: Kanye West raps, hints at split with wife Bianca CensoriRapper Kanye West, in his new song titled 'Bianca', hinted that his wife, Bianca Censori, ran away and had panic attacks. This comes weeks after his anti-semitic posts on X.

PM Modi 'deeply saddened' by Manoj Kumar's death: He was an icon of Indian cinemaPrime Minister Narendra Modi mourned the death of veteran actor Manoj Kumar. The Kranti actor died at a private hospital in Mumbai. He was 87.

Veteran actor Manoj Kumar dies at 87 after battling health issues, tributes pour inVeteran actor Manoj Kumar, who was known for films, 'Roti, Kapada Aur Makaan' and 'Kranti' died at a private hospital in Mumbai. His cremation will take place on Saturday.

Tom Cruise honours 'dear friend' Val Kilmer with a moving tribute at CinemaConTom Cruise paid a touching tribute to his late co-star Val Kilmer at CinemaCon, recalling his immense talent and their special bond. Kilmer, known for roles in Batman Forever and The Doors, died on April 1, leaving a lasting legacy in Hollywood.

Imran Khan reveals how girlfriend Lekha helped him adopt a better lifestyleBollywood actor Imran Khan opened up about how his girlfriend, Lekha Washington, brought significant changes to his lifestyle. He shared an anecdote about not having plates for guests before her influence.

Ajith Kumar goes go-karting with wife Shalini, son Aadvik in ChennaiActor Ajith Kumar is currently on a break in Chennai, spending quality time with his family. He recently enjoyed an exciting day of go-karting with his wife, Shalini, and their son.

Zeenat Aman recalls shooting Pukar song in 'titillating outfit'Veteran actor Zeenat Aman took her fans on a nostalgic journey as she recalled the filming of the iconic song Samundar Mein Naha Ke with Amitabh Bachchan. The shoot was Amitabh Bachchan's comeback after his life-threatening accident on the Coolie set.

Bruce Springsteen surprises fans with Tracks II: The Lost Albums announcementBruce Springsteen is set to release Tracks II: The Lost Albums, a massive seven-album collection featuring 83 songs, including 74 previously unheard tracks.
Ryan Gosling on his next, Project Hail Mary: Massive in scopeHollywood star Ryan Gosling is gearing up for his next, Project Hail Mary. The film star called it a massive and ambitious project.

Jesse Eisenberg, Kieran Culkin's A Real Pain: An ode to shared humanity and lossIn A Real Pain, Jesse Eisenberg and Kieran Culkin star as estranged cousins on a poignant journey through Poland. The film delves into themes of grief, heritage, and the enduring bonds that connect us across generations.
James Bond film in works by Amazon MGM, makers promise an exotic new chapterA new James Bond movie is in the works by Amazon MGM. The makers have promised a brand-new exciting chapter.

The Odyssey: Universal hypes Christopher Nolan film as 'once-in-a-generation' epicUniversal Pictures teased Christopher Nolan's ambitious adaptation of The Odyssey at CinemaCon, promising a cinematic masterpiece.

Jack trailer: Siddu Jonnalagadda turns a spy in this action entertainerActor Siddu Jonnalagadda, known for his roles in the Tillu franchise, steps into a more intense role with the upcoming movie, Jack. The action-comedy, directed by Bommarillu Bhaskar, follows a thrilling mission to eliminate terrorists, blending humour, action, and suspense.

Glen Powell's mother debunks his dating rumours with Sydney SweeneyCyndy Powell addressed the swirling rumours about her son Glen Powell and actress Sydney Sweeney, confirming they are just friends. She highlights their longstanding friendship, dismissing any romantic speculation.

Actor Shivaji Satam's journey as ACP Pradyuman to end in CIDVeteran actor Shivaji Satam's journey will end soon on the iconic Sony TV show CID. Satam essayed the character of ACP Pradyuman in the series.

general news.headline: PM calls Waqf bill passage watershed moment: Will help the marginalisedThe Waqf bill, which gives the government a foot in the door in regulating Waqf properties, was passed by both Houses after marathon debates stretching well past midnight over two days.

No food, one toilet: Passengers fume as 30-hour Turkey airport ordeal drags onStranded passengers detailed a lack of basic amenities at Diyarbakir airport, including insufficient food, water and limited toilet facilities. They also alleged that Virgin Atlantic asked them to arrange onward travel on their own.
Athleisure goes glam, corsets come back: Lakme Fashion Week 2025 trend reportBringing you all the most note-worthy trends from Lakme Fashion Week 2025.

Watch: Trump unveils $5 million 'gold card' for citizenship; rollout by...Donald Trump introduced a $5 million "gold card" for wealthy migrants, calling it a symbol of exclusivity. He claimed to be the first buyer and announced its release within two weeks.

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Payments without treatment under Ayushman scheme? ED raids in Delhi, 3 statesThe ED raids are being conducted following allegations that payments were made without any medical treatment or any patient being admitted to PMJAY-empanelled hospitals.

Centre approves prosecution of Kerala Chief Minister's daughter in corruption caseIn a major setback for the Left Democratic Front in Kerala, the Union government has sanctioned prosecution of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's daughter Veena T in the Cochin Minerals case.

Video: Man dancing with wife on 25th anniversary collapses, dies of heart attackA 50-year-old man, Wasim Sarwat, collapsed and died while dancing with wife Farah at his 25th wedding anniversary in Bareilly.

Rs 2 lakh iPhone? Trump tariffs may drive prices up by 40%Your next iPhone could be a lot more expensive. If Apple passes on the cost, a $799 iPhone could jump to $1,142, and the iPhone 16 Pro Max might hit $2,300. With sales already struggling, higher prices could hurt Apple even more.

Nitish Kumar in RSS attire, dubbed 'Cheatish Kumar' in RJD post for Waqf supportThe RJD attack came as Nitish Kumar's JD(U) felt the after-effects of its support for the Waqf bill, with two prominent leaders resigning from the party in an election year.

20 crore doesn't matter once IPL starts: KKR's Venkatesh on price tag criticsVenkatesh Iyer clapped back at his price tag critics, saying that the money paid on him in the auction doesn't matter once the season starts. Venkatesh played a starring role in KKR's win over SRH.

India fortifies 'Chicken's Neck' as Bangladesh, China eye strategic corridorBangladesh's overtures to China for potential investments have raised concerns in India about the security of the strategically vital Siliguri Corridor, commonly known as the 'Chicken's Neck.'

Gujarat crash: Pilot flew plane away from populated areas to prevent casualtiesOn March 23, Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav got engaged, and his wedding was planned for November 2. However, a technical malfunction in the Jaguar fighter jet led to a crash, claiming the life of the 28-year-old pilot.

My baby she ran away: Kanye West raps, hints at split with wife Bianca CensoriRapper Kanye West, in his new song titled 'Bianca', hinted that his wife, Bianca Censori, ran away and had panic attacks. This comes weeks after his anti-semitic posts on X.

8 dead after inhaling toxic gas inside well in Madhya PradeshEight people died after inhaling suspected toxic gas while cleaning a well in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa district. The victims, who were preparing the well for the Gangour festival, were trapped inside.
Video: Car explodes at Amsterdam's historic Dam Square in possible suicide bidThe incident happened metres away from where a British tourist tackled a suspected knifeman last week.

2 JDU leaders resign over party's support to Waqf bill: 'Trust of Muslims lost'Senior JD(U) leaders Mohammed Qasim Ansari and Mohammed Shahnawaz Malik resigned from the party over its support for the Waqf Amendment Bill.

sports.headline: Didn't get it quite right: Franklin rues poor death bowling against KKRIPL 2025, KKR vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad bowling coach James Franklin said that the Orange Army faltered in the death overs against Kolkata Knight Riders where they leaked 66 runs in their last four overs.

Don't want to be a team which scores 250 and get out for 70 next day: Venkatesh IyerKolkata Knight Riders all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer has said that their team focuses more on showing positive and correct intent after his match-winning innings vs Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH). He stressed that aggression doesn't mean tonking every ball for six but understanding and using the conditions in one's favour.

Live Score, LSG vs MI: Focus on Pant, Rohit as Lucknow host MumbaiIPL 2025 Live Score, Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) vs Mumbai Indians (MI): Rishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants will host Hardik Pandya-led Mumbai Indians at the Ekana Stadium in the Indian Premier League 2025 on Friday. LSG will look to bounce back after their humbling at the hands of Punjab Kings.

Hyper-aggression under review as SRH crash and burn for 3rd straight timeSunRisers Hyderabad lost their third straight game in the Indian Premier League 2025 season. After the match, Pat Cummins said that it was perhaps time to review their hyper-aggressive batting template.

Pant under pressure as struggling Lucknow host rejuvenated MumbaiRishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants will host Mumbai Indians in Match 16 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with an aim to bring their campaign back on track.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
